title: Caroline Flack: Love Island pays tribute to presenter
description: Iain Stirling says he is devastated at the loss of his "true friend" as the ITV2 show returns to air.

title: Memory quilt: Stitching together fragments of a child’s life
description: When teenager Jaxon Elliott-Sprysa died, his mother arranged for something deeply personal to be made.

title: Uefa Champions League: Key battles for Liverpool, Tottenham Hotspur, PSG and Dortmund
description: Football experts from around Europe give the continental view on the first set of Champions League last-16 ties, including Atletico Madrid v Liverpool, and Tottenham v Leipzig.

title: Holden: Historic Australian car brand loved by families and surfers
description: Fans of the Australian brand Holden are sharing memories of their beloved cars on social media.

title: Caroline Flack: Love Island to return with tribute to ex-host
description: It comes after Saturday and Sunday's episodes were cancelled following the ex-host's death aged 40.

title: Coronavirus: Rescue plan 'considered' for Britons trapped on cruise
description: The Foreign office is contacting the 74 passengers trapped in Japan to ask if they want to fly home.

title: Rikki Neave: Man charged with 1994 schoolboy murder
description: The body of six-year-old Rikki Neave was found naked and strangled in woods near his home.

title: 'The doctors say not to play impact sports' - risking hearing loss to reach the Olympics
description: Doctors say Jodie Ounsley risks losing her hearing completely by playing rugby. The teenager is battling for an Olympics sevens spot anyway.

title: Open University scientists testing 'Moon dust' for water
description: Scientists at the Open University are studying minerals collected during the 1969 Moon landings.

title: Storm Dennis: Flood threat remains after weekend of disruption
description: Five severe flood warnings are in place in England, after a weekend of heavy rain and strong winds.

title: Pep Guardiola: Manchester City boss tells friends he intends to stay at club despite Champions League ban
description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola tells friends he intends to stay at the club despite their ban from the Champions League for the next two seasons.

title: Arsenal pass test but still a work in progress - Keown analysis
description: Former Arsenal defender Martin Keown explains what Gunners boss Mikel Arteta changed during the win over Newcastle.

title: Storm Dennis: In pictures
description: Images from around the UK show the strong winds and heavy rain that have swept across the country.

title: HQ Trivia: Quiz app ends with drunken broadcast after 'running out of money'
description: A buyout collapsed, leading to the app closing and a presenter paying for final game's $5 prize.

title: Nikita Pearl Waligwa: Queen of Katwe stars pay tribute
description: Nikita Pearl Waligwa had been diagnosed with a brain tumour and died in Uganda at the age of 15.

title: LeBron James dunk features in NBA All-Star game best plays
description: Watch the best plays from the NBA All-Star Game, which pitched a side led by LeBron James against a team captained by Giannis Antetokounmpo.

title: Brexit: France warns UK of bitter trade negotiations
description: The UK and EU will "rip each other apart" as they vie for advantage, France's foreign minister says.

title: Young carers 'average £12,000 of unpaid work a year'
description: Young carers are spending an average of 25 hours a week looking after loved ones, new research suggests.

title: Du Plessis steps down as South Africa captain
description: Faf du Plessis says it is in the "best interests" of South African cricket that he steps down as captain of the country's Test and Twenty20 sides.

title: Arsenal U15s' Kieran Petrie takes on BBC Sport's Wonderkids challenge
description: In the second episode of BBC Sport's Wonderkids series, Arsenal Under-15 footballer Kieran Petrie aims to beat Leo Castledine's score in a three-part skills challenge.

title: Harry Gregg: Former Manchester United and Northern Ireland goalkeeper dies aged 87
description: Former Manchester United goalkeeper Harry Gregg, who survived the 1958 Munich air crash, has died aged 87.

title: GM scraps historic Holden car brand in Australia
description: The move comes as the US car giant retreats from more markets to focus on more profitable countries.

title: Ex-Man Utd keeper & Munich hero Gregg dies aged 87
description: Former Manchester United goalkeeper Harry Gregg, hailed as a hero of the 1958 Munich air disaster, dies at the age of 87.

title: The Papers: Flack's boyfriend's heartache and 'tough' trade talks
description: The fall-out from Caroline Flack's death and warnings about bitter UK-EU trade talks make the front pages.

title: Amazon: Suspect child car seats found for sale on its store again
description: Trading standards officers are probing the products, which Amazon has now removed from sale.

title: Met Office forecasters set for 'billion pound' supercomputer
description: A new supercomputer is to be built by 2022 to improve the accuracy of weather forecasting.

title: Do voters need therapy?
description: Psychotherapy might have the answers about why we are so emotional about politics.

title: 'I reinvented the hair tie from my uni halls'
description: Sophie Trelles-Tvede is the boss of Invisibobble, which is now sold in more than 70 countries.

title: What would you say to the men who killed your mum?
description: Two teenagers have a cathartic encounter with men jailed for an Islamist attack that killed their mum.

title: Coronavirus: A Cameroon student on how he recovered
description: China-based student Kem Senoua is the first African to contract the virus - he spoke to the BBC.

title: French reforms: Why France is resisting Macron's push on pensions
description: President Macron's pension reforms reach the National Assembly - but the protests have not gone away.

title: Brit Awards: 10 memorable moments ahead of 40th ceremony
description: Starring Jarvis Cocker, Stormzy, Adele, John Prescott and current host Jack Whitehall.

title: Egg-freezing: What's the success rate?
description: The fertility expert Lord Winston warns the success rate could be as low as 1% but others say it is considerably higher.

title: Crossing the border to go to school in the US
description: Sixteen-year-old twins Ana Fernanda and Ana Luisa begin their journey from Mexico in the early hours.

title: Crossing Divides: How to cope when your boss is younger than you
description: Theo is nearly a third of the age of his colleague Charlie - and he manages her. The pair explain how they make the relationship work.

title: Can we fix our way out of the growing e-waste problem?
description: Levels of electrical and electronic waste are expected to more than double by 2050, according to the UN.

title: Coronavirus: Bicester Village 'having a tough time'
description: Retailers are having a "tough time" as the coronavirus keeps Chinese tourists at home.

title: How safe are breast implants?
description: It's a question that's surprisingly difficult to answer.

title: Rape survivor writes poem about attack
description: Michaela Spencer was diagnosed with PTSD after being attacked at a house party.

title: 'I lost my left ear to my tanning addiction'
description: Anthea Smith tells the BBC's Laura Mcmullan, who also had skin cancer, that she used sunbeds for years.

title: The doctors and lawyers giving advice on TikTok
description: The BBC meets the medics and lawyers across America who are using the app to help educate the public.
